module_info.title: Forex Trading Systems
module_info.description: Complete currency trading education with technical analysis, risk management, and news trading

lessons.title: Forex Market Fundamentals
lessons.description: Understanding currency pairs and global markets

detailed_content.introduction: The foreign exchange market is the world's largest financial market with over $7.5 trillion in daily trading volume. Understanding currency pairs and market fundamentals is essential for successful forex trading.

sections.title: Currency Pair Classifications
content: Major Pairs: EUR/USD, GBP/USD, USD/JPY, USD/CHF, AUD/USD, USD/CAD, NZD/USD - highest liquidity and lowest spreads
Minor Pairs (Crosses): EUR/GBP, EUR/JPY, GBP/JPY, AUD/JPY - moderate liquidity without USD
Exotic Pairs: USD/TRY, EUR/ZAR, GBP/MXN - higher spreads and volatility with emerging market currencies
practical_examples: If you buy EUR/USD, you're buying Euros and selling US Dollars
Pip value calculation: For EUR/USD, 1 pip = 0.0001

sections.title: Global Trading Sessions
content: London Session (8:00-17:00 GMT): Highest volume, best for GBP and EUR pairs
New York Session (13:00-22:00 GMT): USD pairs most active, overlaps with London
Tokyo Session (23:00-8:00 GMT): JPY pairs dominate, lower volatility
Sydney Session (21:00-6:00 GMT): AUD/NZD focus, weekend gaps
overlap_strategies: London-New York overlap (13:00-17:00 GMT): Highest volatility and volume
Tokyo-London overlap (8:00-9:00 GMT): Good for JPY pairs
Avoid trading during session gaps for lower spreads

sections.title: Economic Indicators & Market Impact
content: High Impact: Non-Farm Payrolls (NFP), CPI, Interest Rate Decisions, GDP
Medium Impact: Unemployment Rate, Retail Sales, Industrial Production
Low Impact: Consumer Confidence, Manufacturing PMI
indicator_examples: NFP Release: +200K jobs vs 150K expected = USD strength
ECB Rate Hike: 0.25% increase = EUR bullish
UK CPI: 5.2% vs 4.8% expected = GBP rally

sections.title: Central Bank Policies
content: Federal Reserve (USD): FOMC meetings 8 times/year, focus on employment and inflation
European Central Bank (EUR): Monetary policy decisions every 6 weeks
Bank of England (GBP): MPC meetings 8 times/year, inflation targeting
Bank of Japan (JPY): Known for intervention and ultra-low rates

practical_exercises: Identify 5 major currency pairs and their current exchange rates
Calculate pip values for EUR/USD, GBP/JPY, and USD/CAD
Track economic calendar for one week and note market reactions
Observe price action during London-NY session overlap
assessment_questions: What are the three classifications of currency pairs?
Which trading session has the highest volume?
How do central bank interest rate decisions affect currency values?
Calculate the pip value for a $10,000 position in EUR/USD

recommended_reading: Currency Trading & Intermarket Analysis by Ashraf Laidi
The Little Book of Currency Trading by Kathy Lien

lessons.title: Technical Analysis for Forex
lessons.description: Chart patterns and indicators specific to currency trading

detailed_content.introduction: Technical analysis is crucial for forex trading success. Currency pairs exhibit predictable patterns and respond well to technical indicators when combined with fundamental analysis.

sections.title: Support and Resistance Levels
content: Support: Price level where buying pressure exceeds selling pressure
Resistance: Price level where selling pressure exceeds buying pressure
Psychological levels: Round numbers like 1.2000, 1.2500
Previous highs/lows become future resistance/support
identification_methods: Horizontal lines at previous swing highs/lows
Volume profile analysis at key price levels
trading_strategies: Buy at support with tight stop loss below support
Sell at resistance with stop loss above resistance
Breakout trading: Enter when price breaks through with volume
False breakout: Fade breakouts that quickly reverse

sections.title: Trend Line Analysis
content: Uptrend: Series of higher highs and higher lows
Downtrend: Series of lower highs and lower lows
Sideways trend: Price moves within horizontal range
drawing_techniques: Connect at least 2-3 significant highs for resistance trend line
Connect at least 2-3 significant lows for support trend line
Use wicks/shadows, not just closing prices
The more touches, the stronger the trend line
trend_line_strategies: Buy bounces off uptrend support line
Sell bounces off downtrend resistance line
Use trend lines as trailing stop loss levels

sections.title: Moving Average Strategies
content: Simple Moving Average (SMA): Arithmetic mean of prices
Exponential Moving Average (EMA): More weight to recent prices
Common periods: 20, 50, 100, 200
moving_average_systems: Golden Cross: 50 EMA crosses above 200 EMA (bullish)
Death Cross: 50 EMA crosses below 200 EMA (bearish)
EMA bounce strategy: Price bounces off 20/50 EMA in trending market
practical_application: EUR/USD: Use 20/50 EMA crossover for trend changes
GBP/JPY: 200 SMA as major trend filter
USD/CAD: EMA bounce strategy during strong trends
Multiple timeframe analysis: Daily for trend, H4 for entries

sections.title: RSI and MACD Signals
content: RSI (Relative Strength Index): Momentum oscillator (0-100)
MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence): Trend-following momentum
rsi_strategies: Divergence: Price makes new high/low but RSI doesn't
RSI trend line breaks: Draw trend lines on RSI itself
macd_strategies: MACD line crosses above signal line: Bullish
MACD line crosses below signal line: Bearish
Zero line cross: MACD above/below zero confirms trend
combination_strategies: RSI oversold + MACD bullish cross = Strong buy signal
Price at support + RSI divergence = Reversal setup
MACD histogram declining + RSI overbought = Exit signal

practical_exercises: Draw support/resistance on EUR/USD daily chart
Identify trend lines on GBP/JPY 4-hour chart
Set up 20/50 EMA system on USD/JPY
Find RSI divergences on AUD/USD weekly chart
Combine MACD and RSI signals for entry timing

case_studies.scenario: ECB dovish stance with technical breakdown
case_studies.setup: Price breaks below 1.0800 support, RSI oversold but no divergence
case_studies.action: Wait for RSI to show bullish divergence before buying

case_studies.setup: Price bounces off 200 SMA, MACD shows bullish cross
case_studies.action: Long position with stop below 200 SMA

lessons.title: Risk Management in Forex
lessons.description: Protecting capital in leveraged currency trading

detailed_content.introduction: Risk management is the most critical aspect of forex trading. With leverage up to 500:1, proper risk control determines long-term success or failure.

sections.title: Position Sizing with Leverage
content: Leverage amplifies both profits and losses
1% rule: Never risk more than 1% of account per trade
2% rule: Maximum 2% risk for experienced traders
Account size determines maximum position size
position_sizing_formulas: Risk Amount = Account Size × Risk Percentage
Position Size = Risk Amount ÷ (Entry Price - Stop Loss)
Lot Size = Position Size ÷ Contract Size
Max Leverage = Account Size ÷ Margin Required
practical_examples: $10,000 account, 1% risk = $100 maximum risk per trade
EUR/USD at 1.0800, stop at 1.0750, risk 50 pips = 20,000 units
Standard lot = 100,000 units = 0.2 lots for this trade
leverage_guidelines: Professional traders: Up to 100:1 with strict rules
Avoid maximum leverage offered by brokers

sections.title: Stop Loss Placement Strategies
content: Technical stop loss: Based on chart patterns
Volatility stop loss: Based on ATR (Average True Range)
Percentage stop loss: Fixed percentage from entry
Time-based stop loss: Exit after specific time period
atr_based_stops: Adjust ATR multiplier based on market volatility
stop_loss_best_practices: Place stops at logical technical levels
Don't move stops against your position
Use trailing stops in profitable trades

sections.title: Risk-Reward Ratios
content: Minimum 1:2 risk-reward ratio recommended
1:3 risk-reward allows 75% losing trades
Calculate profit target before entering trade
Adjust position size based on R:R ratio
risk_reward_calculations: Risk = Entry Price - Stop Loss Price
Reward = Take Profit Price - Entry Price
expectancy_formula: Expectancy = (Win Rate × Average Win) - (Loss Rate × Average Loss)
Example: 40% wins, avg win $300, avg loss $100

sections.title: Currency Correlation Analysis
content: Positive correlation: Pairs move in same direction
Negative correlation: Pairs move in opposite directions
Correlation coefficient: -1 to +1 range
Correlations change over time and market conditions
major_correlations: EUR/USD vs GBP/USD: Usually positive correlation
USD/CHF vs EUR/USD: Strong negative correlation
AUD/USD vs NZD/USD: High positive correlation
USD/JPY vs EUR/JPY: Moderate positive correlation
correlation_risk_management: Avoid multiple positions in highly correlated pairs
Reduce position size when trading correlated pairs
Monitor correlations during major news events
commodity_currency_correlations: AUD/USD vs Gold prices: Positive correlation
CAD/USD vs Oil prices: Strong positive correlation
NZD/USD vs Dairy prices: Moderate correlation

risk_management_checklist: ✓ Never risk more than 1-2% per trade
✓ Set stop loss before entering position
✓ Calculate position size based on stop distance
✓ Keep trading journal with R:R ratios
✓ Review and adjust risk parameters monthly
common_mistakes: Risking too much on 'sure thing' trades
Ignoring correlation when opening multiple positions
Not calculating position size before entry

lessons.title: News Trading Strategies
lessons.description: Trading economic announcements and market events

detailed_content.introduction: News trading in forex requires precise timing, risk management, and understanding of market expectations vs. actual results. Economic releases can cause 100+ pip moves in minutes.

sections.title: Economic Calendar Mastery
content: High impact events: NFP, CPI, Interest Rate decisions, GDP
Medium impact: Unemployment, Retail Sales, PMI
Low impact: Consumer Confidence, Factory Orders
market_reaction_patterns: Same as forecast: Minimal reaction typical
Opposite to forecast: Strong reversal possible
pre_news_preparation: Set up charts with tight spreads broker
Prepare position sizes and risk parameters

sections.title: NFP (Non-Farm Payrolls) Trading
content: Released first Friday of each month at 8:30 AM ET
Most important US employment indicator
Affects USD across all major pairs
Average move: 50-150 pips in first hour
nfp_trading_strategies: Straddle strategy: Pending orders above/below current price
Fade strategy: Trade against initial knee-jerk reaction
Momentum strategy: Follow direction after first 15 minutes
Wait and see: Enter after initial volatility subsides
nfp_setup_example: Place buy stop at 1.0820, sell stop at 1.0780
Stop loss 20 pips, take profit 40 pips (1:2 R:R)
Cancel unfilled order after first move completes
nfp_key_components: Headline number: Change in non-farm employment
Average hourly earnings: Wage inflation measure
Labor force participation: Economic health indicator

sections.title: CPI (Consumer Price Index) Trading
content: Monthly inflation data from major economies
Core CPI excludes food and energy (more stable)
Fed's 2% inflation target is key reference
High CPI = hawkish policy expectations
cpi_trading_approach: Focus on Core CPI vs headline CPI
Compare to central bank's inflation target
Watch for sustained trends over single readings
cpi_currency_impact: Higher than expected CPI = Currency strength
Lower than expected CPI = Currency weakness
Persistent high CPI = Interest rate hike expectations
cpi_trading_pairs: USD pairs: US CPI affects all USD crosses
EUR pairs: Eurozone CPI impacts ECB policy
GBP pairs: UK CPI influences BOE decisions
CAD pairs: Canadian CPI affects BOC stance

sections.title: Central Bank Announcements
content: FOMC: Federal Open Market Committee (8x/year)
ECB: European Central Bank (8x/year)
BOE: Bank of England (8x/year)
BOJ: Bank of Japan (8x/year)
announcement_components: Economic projections: Growth and inflation forecasts
trading_central_bank_events: Rate hike surprise: Currency strength (50-200 pips)
No change as expected: Minimal reaction
fomc_trading_strategy: Pre-positioning based on economic data trends
Focus on USD pairs with highest liquidity
Watch for Jerome Powell's press conference tone

sections.title: Volatility Management
content: News events increase volatility dramatically
Spreads widen significantly during releases
Slippage risk higher with market orders
Liquidity decreases in first few minutes
volatility_preparation: Reduce position sizes by 50% during news
Use limit orders instead of market orders
Widen stop losses to account for volatility
Avoid trading 5 minutes before/after major news
spread_management: ECN brokers typically have tighter spreads
Factor spread cost into profit calculations
news_trading_schedule: 8:30 AM ET: Most US economic data
10:00 AM ET: US factory orders, wholesale inventories

news_trading_rules: Never trade without knowing upcoming high-impact news
Always have predetermined risk management plan
Don't chase moves after initial 15-minute reaction
Keep positions small during volatile news periods
Focus on major currency pairs for better execution

advanced_strategies.description: Trade central bank decisions with clear binary outcomes
advanced_strategies.execution: Straddle setup with tight stops, quick profit taking

advanced_strategies.description: Trade against market consensus when technically justified
advanced_strategies.execution: Wait for initial move, then fade if technical levels hold

advanced_strategies.description: Trade correlation between related economic indicators
advanced_strategies.execution: Combine employment data with inflation data for stronger signals
